pullrequest.title: Add ability to specify GUI plugins that appear over render window
Add ability to specify GUI plugins that appear over render window

content.raw:
The [report on Mac](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-homebrew_bcn-amd64/143/consoleFull) displays some errors in linking:

```
219: Linking CXX shared library libgui_example_time_widget.dylib
219: Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
219:   "google::protobuf::MessageLite::ParseFromString(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&)", referenced from:
219:       gazebo::transport::CallbackHelperT<gazebo::msgs::WorldStatistics>::HandleData(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&, boost::function<void (unsigned int)>, unsigned int) in GUIExampleTimeWidget.cc.o
219:   "typeinfo for google::protobuf::Message", referenced from:
219:       boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::msgs::WorldStatistics> boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<gazebo::msgs::WorldStatistics, google::protobuf::Message>(boost::shared_ptr<google::protobuf::Message> const&) in GUIExampleTimeWidget.cc.o
219: ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
219: clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
```

```
19: Linking CXX shared library libgui_example_spawn_widget.dylib
219: Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
219:   "google::protobuf::internal::kEmptyString", referenced from:
219:       gazebo::msgs::Factory::set_sdf(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&) in GUIExampleSpawnWidget.cc.o
219: ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
219: clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
```

Maybe we need to include protobuf in linking?
content.html:
The report on Mac displays some errors in linking:

219: Linking CXX shared library libgui_example_time_widget.dylib
219: Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
219:   "google::protobuf::MessageLite::ParseFromString(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&)", referenced from:
219:       gazebo::transport::CallbackHelperT<gazebo::msgs::WorldStatistics>::HandleData(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&, boost::function<void (unsigned int)>, unsigned int) in GUIExampleTimeWidget.cc.o
219:   "typeinfo for google::protobuf::Message", referenced from:
219:       boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::msgs::WorldStatistics> boost::dynamic_pointer_cast<gazebo::msgs::WorldStatistics, google::protobuf::Message>(boost::shared_ptr<google::protobuf::Message> const&) in GUIExampleTimeWidget.cc.o
219: ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
219: clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)

19: Linking CXX shared library libgui_example_spawn_widget.dylib
219: Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
219:   "google::protobuf::internal::kEmptyString", referenced from:
219:       gazebo::msgs::Factory::set_sdf(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&) in GUIExampleSpawnWidget.cc.o
219: ld: symbol(s) not found for architecture x86_64
219: clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)

Maybe we need to include protobuf in linking?

pullrequest.title: Add ability to specify GUI plugins that appear over render window

content.raw:
You are right, we don't need to use include with that find file. And yes, it solve the problem in Mac.

@nkoenig could you please back to merge from my branch so you get cfcdb13?

You are right, we don't need to use include with that find file. And yes, it solve the problem in Mac.
